Name: Tweezers in the form of a horse
Description: This object in bronze consists of the upper part of some tweezers. It depicts a horse whose fore-legs hold the upper half of the tweezers. The back legs have a lotus flower which could serve as a small razor. The lower part was comprised of a fine strip of bronze attached at the place of the hole of the upper part. This toilette article has known great popularity in the New Kingdom.
